67887ca5-66ab-44bc-9083-42ba91bbeae8.description: This nationally accredited unit forms a strong foundation for clinical practice by exploring the theoretical principles of dermal procedures using laser and light-based systems. Earners of this badge have developed comprehensive knowledge in relation to laser and light physics including tissue interaction, parameter selection and treatment protocols.
67887ca5-66ab-44bc-9083-42ba91bbeae8.name: CDNLBT02 Analyse light based therapies used in cosmetic medicine

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

alignments.name: Radiological Council of WA
alignments.description: This unit of competency is recognised by the Radiological Council of WA as a Laser Safety Officers course (a prerequisite to laser licensing in WA, QLD and Tas).

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualifications; Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables, Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science and the Advanced Diploma of Cosmetic Dermal Science.

0a0bc8eb-b1fb-41c7-966c-fecd075f64cf.description: This nationally accredited unit of competency forms a strong foundation for clinical practice by exploring the theoretical principles of epidermal resurfacing procedures. Earners of this badge take an evidence-based approach to the principles of clinical microdermabrasion, chemical resurfacing and micro/skin needling in order to achieve safe and effective treatment outcomes and adhere to best practice polices.
0a0bc8eb-b1fb-41c7-966c-fecd075f64cf.name: CDNERT02 Analyse epidermal resurfacing techniques

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualifications; Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables, Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science and the Advanced Diploma of Cosmetic Dermal Science.

e3b0c7a1-bde1-4853-b524-ff1400dc8ace.description: This nationally accredited unit of competency significantly enhances the earners knowledge of key ingredients used in over-the-counter cosmeceuticals and prescription pharmaceuticals. Earners of this badge can use an evidence-based approach to effectively treat common skin concerns and complement cosmetic surgical and/or dermal therapy procedures using specific cosmeceutical ingredients.
e3b0c7a1-bde1-4853-b524-ff1400dc8ace.name: CDNEFC02 Evaluate the use and formulation of cosmeceuticals

alignments.description: This unit is recognised by one of Australia's leading cosmeceutical manufacturers and suppliers - Ultraceuticals. Students gain additional learning through the UltraAcademy.

alignments.name: DermaList
alignments.description: This unit is recognised by Australia's newest boutique cosmeceutical manufacturers and suppliers - DermaList. Students gain additional learning through a product knowledge course developed and delivered by DermaList.

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualifications; Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science, Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables and the Advanced Diploma of Cosmetic Dermal Science.

5bac0be2-10da-4268-9b83-3581eeb64b20.description: This nationally recognised unit of competency provides aesthetic professionals with the essential knowledge and skills to maintain infection prevention in all areas associated with dermal and cosmetic injectable procedures. Earners of this badge understand the current state or territory hygiene regulations and the key principles of infection prevention in a cosmetic medical context.
5bac0be2-10da-4268-9b83-3581eeb64b20.name: HLTINF005 Maintain infection prevention for skin penetration treatments

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

alignments.name: QLD Radiation Health
alignments.description: The unit HLTINF005 Maintain infection prevention for skin penetration treatments is recognised by QLD Radiation Health as meeting part of the laser licence criteria for hair removal, vascular, tattoo removal and skin rejuvenation treatment categories.

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualifications; Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science, Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables and the Advanced Diploma of Cosmetic Dermal Science.

6c731896-406a-48cf-9bbe-49e9133b57ae.description: This nationally accredited unit of competency ensures effective communication and assessment strategies are adopted during patient consultation. Earners of this badge use sound assessment strategies as part of a holistic consultation including referral, informed consent, written and photo documentation and other information to support positive patient outcomes.
6c731896-406a-48cf-9bbe-49e9133b57ae.name: CDNCAS01 Apply communication and assessment strategies to patient consultation

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualifications; Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables, Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science and the Advanced Diploma of Cosmetic Dermal Science.

9b8e1572-00b1-442c-bcba-80c14ef730f5.description: This nationally accredited unit forms the foundation for understanding how the gut microbiome and nutritional and lifestyle factors impact skin health. Earners of this badge understand the conception of the microbiome, hormonal and digestive health and detoxification. They are also able to identify nutritional and lifestyle factors that affect the skin through poor microbiome and implement strategies to improve patient outcomes.
9b8e1572-00b1-442c-bcba-80c14ef730f5.name: CDNIHD01 Integrated health and dermatology for aesthetic practice

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualifications; Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science and the Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables.

fba78978-c021-42b9-98b4-81e9941c04e9.description: This nationally accredited unit of competency provides nurses with an in-depth knowledge of commonly performed cosmetic surgical procedures. Earners of this badge have examined the indications, techniques, complications, pre/post-operative care, and recovery involved in cosmetic surgical procedures and are able to analyse the face and body in view of advising suitable procedure options.
fba78978-c021-42b9-98b4-81e9941c04e9.name: CDNESP02 Evaluate Cosmetic Surgical Procedures

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualification; Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables

490910a3-3f06-4c85-bc9b-8160a9982f73.description: This nationally accredited unit of competency forms the foundation for correct skin analysis and selection of dermal therapy procedures within a cosmetic medical context. Earners of this badge understand skin physiology, the presentation and pathophysiology of dermatologic disorders, skin repair abilities and wound care. They can identify a range of dermatologic and cosmetic skin conditions to work within their scope of practice or refer to other medical professionals.
490910a3-3f06-4c85-bc9b-8160a9982f73.name: CDNPDD02 Apply principles of dermatology and dermatoscopy to cosmetic medicine

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

alignments.name: Dermal Health Alliance
alignments.description: The Dermal Health Alliance proudly offers skin cancer assessments and mobile melanography with specific partners and clinics. The mission of the Dermal Health Alliance is to support holistic skin health by creating greater access to Skin Cancer surveillance services and supporting treatment strategies for compromised and sun-damaged skins.

alignments.name: Australian Dermatology Nurses Association
alignments.description: The aim of the ADNA is to promote the best standard of care for the dermatology patient. Their goal is to promote the development and recognition of the nurses’ role in dermatology for the benefit of the patient and to promote the education and professional development of the dermatology nurse.

badge_template_activities.title: This nationally accredited unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualifications; Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables and the Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science.
The practical component of this unit involves the student using a dermatoscope to identify and examine skin lesions to enhance dermal procedures and provide a holistic approach to dermal practice.

a58381e3-bf46-4716-9c1e-20d9a93632cc.description: This nationally accredited unit provides an in-depth knowledge and understanding of each cosmetic surgical and non-surgical procedure. Earners of this badge have examined the indications, techniques, complications and recovery of common cosmetic procedures and are able to discuss the analysis of face and body in view of advising suitable procedures.
a58381e3-bf46-4716-9c1e-20d9a93632cc.name: CDNSCP02 Evaluate Surgical and Non-Surgical Cosmetic Procedures

b7edf336-c1cb-4481-bc5b-d031fcebce5a.description: This postgraduate course is developed specifically for qualified Nurses entering the field of cosmetic medicine. Earners of this nationally accredited qualification hold the knowledge and hands-on practical skills required to work in a cosmetic medical practice performing a range of dermal therapies, injectable procedures and cosmetic nursing duties.
b7edf336-c1cb-4481-bc5b-d031fcebce5a.name: 52852WA Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables

alignments.description: The 52852WA Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables is recognised by the Radiological Council of WA as meeting the laser licence exemption criteria for hair removal, vascular and pigment treatment categories.

alignments.name: Merz Aesthetics
alignments.description: On completion of the unit CDNEIP02 Evaluate and perform cosmetic injectables procedures, students are awarded additional certificates from Merz Aesthetics Insitute.

badge_template_activities.title: 52852WA Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables is a nationally accredited qualification and is recognised as a level 8 Graduate Diploma on the Australian Qualification Framework.

35cdab76-4935-4b89-a514-7a77579d9438.description: Managerial and marketing skills are an important asset to have in any small business environment and is a competency highly sought after by potential employers in the field of aesthetics. Earners of this badge understand the key management and marketing skills required to establish, grow and promote a cosmetic medical or non-medical clinic. Skills include ethical marketing strategies and the regulations surrounding the marketing of cosmetic procedures in Australia.
35cdab76-4935-4b89-a514-7a77579d9438.name: CDNMCP01 Manage and promote the cosmetic practice

5c9f862f-1dca-465e-9738-21f808f8058c.description: This nationally accredited unit of competency provides nurses with the underpinning theoretical knowledge and skills development for administering basic cosmetic injectable procedures. Clinical skills are developed through supervised hands-on case studies requiring consultation, informed consent, facial analysis, product selection and dosage and patient aftercare advice to ensure a complete and effective cosmetic medical service.
5c9f862f-1dca-465e-9738-21f808f8058c.name: CDNEIP02 Evaluate and perform cosmetic injectable procedures

alignments.description: This unit is recognised by one of Australia's leading international aesthetics and neurotoxin manufacturers and suppliers and Merz Institute of Advanced Aesthetics; an expert-led educational resource devoted to advancing knowledge and providing HCP’s with academic knowledge and practical skills to compete in the area of aesthetics.

badge_template_activities.title: This unit of competency is a core unit in the following nationally accredited qualification; Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables.

31476f97-697e-4468-926b-6a191381b2f1.description: This nationally accredited unit of competency provides the earner with the underpinning knowledge in human anatomy and physiology and a foundation for further studies in dermal science. Earners of this badge have explored each organ system and its relevance to skin health and dermal procedures with strong focus on how environmental factors, genetics, intrinsic ageing and endocrine changes affect the histological and visual qualities of the skin.
31476f97-697e-4468-926b-6a191381b2f1.name: CDNAAP01 Apply anatomy and physiology to dermal therapies

951fc16b-89ac-45bc-9139-5cf764d897b9.description: This undergraduate course is developed for candidates to work as a qualified Dermal Therapist in a cosmetic medical practice or dermal clinic. The earner of this badge has the knowledge and skills required to perform a range of dermal therapy procedures within a cosmetic medical context.
951fc16b-89ac-45bc-9139-5cf764d897b9.name: 52850WA Advanced Diploma of Cosmetic Dermal Science

c72445c7-38b6-4da8-87f0-9c3ffd301e29.description: Dermal therapy involves the close and personal interaction with patients, and a background knowledge of personality types and human behaviour enables the Dermal Therapist to have a greater understanding of patient care. Earners of this badge understand psychosocial aspects of cosmetic medicine and surgery, self-perception (body dysmorphic disorder and anorexia), global perceptions of beauty and the role of the media in cosmetic medicine.
c72445c7-38b6-4da8-87f0-9c3ffd301e29.name: CDNPPC02 Analyse the principles of psychology in a cosmetic medical context

1358dd1e-2109-45ef-82f0-880bef5c4fed.description: This postgraduate course is developed for candidates from a beauty or health background wanting to achieve a formal and recognised qualification in dermal science. 1358dd1e-2109-45ef-82f0-880bef5c4fed.name: 52854WA Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science

25da38cc-cb59-48f4-a7f3-78398a9436e4.description: Dermal Science Practical is a cluster of nationally accredited units of competency encompassing the following skills as aligned in the scope of practice for a cosmetic nurse or dermal therapist; patient consultation, skin analysis, laser and IPL procedures, LED therapy, chemical peeling, skin needling, microdermabrasion and infection prevention. These skills form key clinical competencies practiced in a cosmetic medical context.
25da38cc-cb59-48f4-a7f3-78398a9436e4.name: Dermal Science Practical

4e9eb773-981e-4fc7-a4c1-fe7e358ca7d0.description: This professional certificate forms the foundation for understanding how the gut microbiome and nutritional and lifestyle factors impact skin health. Earners of this badge understand the conception of the microbiome, hormonal and digestive health and detoxification. They are also able to identify nutritional and lifestyle factors that affect the skin through poor microbiome and implement strategies to improve patient outcomes.
4e9eb773-981e-4fc7-a4c1-fe7e358ca7d0.name: Professional Certificate in Integrated Health and Dermatology

alignments.name: Vita-Sol Product Range Training
alignments.description: This course provides additional product knowledge training in the Vita-Sol range of nutraceuticals for dermal therapists and nurses to enhance efficacy of both topical skincare and dermal therapies.

badge_template_activities.title: This professional certificate provides credit (with additional assessment) into  the following Nationally accredited Qualifications: Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables and the Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science.

10285fcb-99c7-4fee-9b6f-146b2e4d5b47.description: This is a theory-based course, which focuses on the clinical aspects of IPL and Laser treatment and the required safety standards as outlined by the Radiation Safety Act. It is recognised by the two main Laser authorities; QLD Radiation Health and the Radiological Council of WA as an official Radiation/Laser Safety Officer’s Certificate.
10285fcb-99c7-4fee-9b6f-146b2e4d5b47.name: Laser Safety Course

alignments.name: QLD Radiation Health
alignments.description: This course is recognised by QLD Radiation Health as a Laser Safety Officers course (a prerequisite to laser licensing in WA, QLD and Tas).

alignments.name: Radiological Council of WA
alignments.description: This course is recognised by the Radiological Council of WA as a Laser Safety Officers course (a prerequisite to laser licensing in WA, QLD and Tas).

badge_template_activities.title: The exam for this course encompasses; Laser and light physics, mechanics of laser and light systems, lasers in cosmetic medicine and dermal therapies,  licensing, state regulations and risk assessment and management. This course provides credit (with additional assessment) into  the following Nationally accredited Qualifications; Advanced Diploma of Cosmetic Dermal Science, Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables and the Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science.

9df48260-633b-4ba3-af54-64290d4076b8.description: Earners of this badge recognise the correct information about cosmetic ingredients, reliable sources and safety and compliance limits of cosmetic ingredients, how to read chemical information and how to evaluate the science used in Cosmetic Formulation. This module also contains crucial information about microbial limits, control and Good Manufacturing Practice.
9df48260-633b-4ba3-af54-64290d4076b8.name: Personal Care Formulation: Module 1

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

badge_template_activities.title: This module forms part one of the 10788NAT Diploma of Personal Care Formulation, which is a nationally accredited course recognised as a Diploma (level 5) qualification on the Australian Qualification Framework.

d7f60f73-1ee1-44d4-8092-d64703ff22a0.description: This course forms the foundation for correct skin analysis and selection of dermal therapy procedures within a cosmetic medical context. Earners of this badge understand skin physiology, the presentation and pathophysiology of dermatologic disorders, skin repair abilities and wound care. They are able to identify a range of dermatologic and cosmetic skin conditions in order to work within their scope of practice or refer to other medical professionals.
d7f60f73-1ee1-44d4-8092-d64703ff22a0.name: Professional Certificate in Dermatology and Dermatoscopy for Aesthetic Practice

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

badge_template_activities.title: This is a theory course with three assessments in the form of case studies, workbook and a multiple choice question quiz at the end of the course. This professional certificate provides credit (with additional assessment) into the following Nationally accredited Qualifications: Graduate Diploma of Cosmetic Nursing and Injectables and the Graduate Diploma of Dermal Science.

dd7dc856-2e29-41d2-a256-f8391136931f.description: The earner of this badge has a comprehensive approach to the formulation of safe, stable and efficacious personal care products for the hair, hands, body and face. They have developed products from the concept stage through to reverse engineering. Badge earners are able to prepare a variety of personal care products, adapt formulations to suit organisational requirements and develop products based on the latest industry advances.
dd7dc856-2e29-41d2-a256-f8391136931f.name: 10788NAT Diploma of Personal Care Formulation

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

alignments.name: Australian Society of Cosmetic Chemists
alignments.description: The 10788NAT Diploma of Personal Care Formulation is recognised by the Australian Society of Cosmetic Chemists as meeting the educational requirements to become a qualified Cosmetic Chemist / Formulator.

badge_template_activities.title: The 10788NAT Diploma of Personal Care Formulation is a nationally accredited course recognised as a Diploma (level 5) qualification on the Australian Qualification Framework.

82e5a51e-3f8e-4e5b-8104-e9c9596f502a.description: Earners of this badge can understand how skin and hair physiology impact ingredient selection to suit specific product briefs and consumer needs.This brings together elements of selection to ensure safe,stable,and effective product formulations.This module teaches how to plan and conduct stability testing,interpret results,as well as how to identify potential issues with formulations and make required corrections. There is also an emphasis on highly advanced and specialised product innovation.
82e5a51e-3f8e-4e5b-8104-e9c9596f502a.name: Personal Care Formulation: Module 3

issuer.summary: issued by Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

entity.name: Australasian Academy of Cosmetic Dermal Science

badge_template_activities.title: This module forms part three of the 10788NAT Diploma of Personal Care Formulation, which is a nationally accredited course recognised as a Diploma (level 5) qualification on the Australian Qualification Framework.

cee75e44-b9f2-487f-bbee-c9ff314b6f3f.description: Earners of this badge can identify different ingredient categories such as gums and polymers for rheology modification and formulation stabilisation; oils, butters, waxes and silicones for sensory and viscosity modification; fragrances and essential oils for market appeal and impacting aromas; emulsifiers for emulsion formation and stability,and surfactants for foaming and cleansing products. It covers the safety,regulations and formulation considerations when creating cosmetic aerosol products.
cee75e44-b9f2-487f-bbee-c9ff314b6f3f.name: Personal Care Formulation: Module 2

Earners of this badge understand the key management and marketing skills required to establish, grow and promote a cosmetic medical or non-medical clinic. Skills include ethical marketing strategies and the regulations surrounding the marketing of cosmetic procedures in Australia.
